{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.04746v1", "title": "The Cohen-Macaulay property of invariant rings over ring of integers of
  a global field-II", "summary": "Let $A$ be the ring of integers of a number field $K$. Let $G \subseteq
GL_3(A)$ be a finite group. Let $G$ act linearly on $R = A[X,Y, Z]$ (fixing
$A$) and let $S = R^G$ be the ring of invariants. Assume the Veronese subring
$S^{<m>}$ of $S$ is standard graded. We prove that if for all primes $p$
dividing $|G|$, the Sylow $p$-subgroup of $G$ has exponent $p$ then for all $l
\gg 0$ the Veronese subring $S^{<ml>}$ of $S$ is Cohen-Macaulay. We prove a
similar result if for all primes $p$ dividing $|G|$, the prime $p$ is
unramified in $K$.", "main_category": "math.AC", "categories": "math.AC", "published": "2025-04-07T05:39:40Z"}
